returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The get_CountryCode method retrieves the country/region code that establishes the current channel-to-frequency mapping.

param.name: plCountryCode
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the country/region code currently in use by the TV Tuner filter.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: The method determines which channel-to-frequency mapping table to use. This establishes the base frequencies for the given country/region. Use the method to determine the exact frequencies for specific regions.
Override the country/region code when a country/region wants to receive broadcast video from a different national source. For a list of country/region codes, see International Analog TV Tuning.

summary.para: The get_Mode method retrieves the current mode on a multifunction tuner.

param.name: plMode
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a flag indicating the current mode setting. The possible values are defined in the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: The get_TuningSpace method retrieves the tuning space.

param.name: plTuningSpace
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the current tuning space.

remarks.para: The application defines the value retrieved by this method; it is set through a call to .

summary.para: The Logon method logs a user onto the system.

param.name: hCurrentUser
param.para: Handle to an application-defined data structure that identifies the current user.

remarks.para: The Logon and Logout methods enable you to implement selective user access.

summary.para: The Logout method logs out the current user.
The put_Channel method sets the TV channel.

param.name: lChannel
param.para: TV channel number.

param.name: lVideoSubChannel
param.para: Predefined video subchannel value. Specify AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_NO_TUNE for no tuning or AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_DEFAULT for default subchannel. Meaningful only for satellite broadcasts.

param.name: lAudioSubChannel
param.para: Predefined audio subchannel value. Specify AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_NO_TUNE for no tuning or AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_DEFAULT for default subchannel. Meaningful only for satellite broadcasts.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: This method handles the channel-to-frequency function call that converts the TV channel to a TV frequency. For a list of frequencies for channels, see International Analog TV Tuning.

summary.para: The put_CountryCode method sets the country/region code to establish the frequency to use.

param.name: lCountryCode
param.para: Value indicating the country/region code.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: This method establishes the base frequencies for the given country/region. Use the method to determine the exact frequencies for specific regions, unless there are previously cached settings for the new country/region.

Because channels in different countries/regions map to different frequencies, worldwide mapping tables are provided in the appendix International Analog TV Tuning. Override the existing country/region code by selecting the new value from the appendix and passing it in as the parameter for the put_CountryCode method. This is useful when a country/region wants to receive broadcast video from a different national source.

summary.para: The put_Mode method sets a multifunction tuner to the specified mode.

param.name: lMode
param.para: Flag indicating which mode to switch to. Possible values are defined in the enumeration.
You can also set the mode to digital TV if the card supports it. To do this, define AMTUNER_MODE_DTV with a value of 0x0010.

summary.para: The put_TuningSpace method sets a storage index for regional channel-to-frequency mappings.

param.name: lTuningSpace
param.para: Value indicating the current locale.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

remarks.para: As TV tuners move into portable systems, you must retain locale-specific mappings of available channels and their actual frequencies. Formulating different lTuningSpace values for each locale provides a way of switching the channel-to-frequency mappings when moving from region to region.

summary.para: The SignalPresent method retrieves the strength of the signal on a given channel.

param.name: plSignalStrength
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a value indicating whether a signal is present on the current channel. Can be one of the following values.
A value of AMTUNER_HASNOSIGNALSTRENGTH means the signal strength cannot be determined at this time.

summary.para: The UnRegisterNotificationCallBack method unregisters an object for event notifications.

param.name: pNotify
param.para: Pointer to the interface that was specified in a previous call to RegisterNotificationCallBack.

summary.para: The IAMTuner interface controls a TV tuner. This interface is the base class for the interface, which inherits all of the IAMTuner methods. For more information on controlling a TV tuner using Microsoft DirectShow, see the IAMTVTuner documentation.
